verses.verse: "I have come <S%H935><s%> into my garden, <S%H1588><s%> my sister, <S%H269><s%> [my] bride; <S%H3618><s%> I have gathered <S%H717><s%> my myrrh <S%H4753><s%> along <S%H5973><s%> with my balsam. <S%H1314><s%> I have eaten <S%H398><s%> my honeycomb <S%H3293><s%> and my honey; <S%H1706><s%> I have drunk <S%H8354><s%> my wine <S%H3196><s%> and my milk. <S%H2461><s%> Eat, <S%H398><s%> friends; <S%H7453><s%> Drink <S%H8354><s%> and imbibe <S%H7937><s%> deeply, <S%H7937><s%> O lovers. <S%H1730><s%>"

"I was asleep, <S%H3463><s%> but my heart <S%H3820><s%> was awake. <S%H5782><s%> A voice! <S%H6963><s%> My beloved <S%H1730><s%> was knocking: <S%H1849><s%> 'Open <S%H6605><s%> to me, my sister, <S%H269><s%> my darling, <S%H7474><s%> My dove, <S%H3123><s%> my perfect <S%H8535><s%> one! <S%H8535><s%> For my head <S%H7218><s%> is drenched <S%H4390><s%> with dew, <S%H2919><s%> My locks <S%H6977><s%> with the damp <S%H7447><s%> of the night. <S%H3915><s%>'

"I have taken <S%H6584><s%> off <S%H6584><s%> my dress, <S%H3801><s%> How <S%H9010><s%> can I put <S%H3847><s%> it on [again?] I have washed <S%H7364><s%> my feet, <S%H7272><s%> How <S%H9010><s%> can I dirty <S%H2936><s%> them [again?]
"My beloved <S%H1730><s%> extended <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> through <S%H4480><s%> the opening, <S%H2356><s%> And my feelings <S%H4578><s%> were aroused <S%H1993><s%> for him.

"I arose <S%H6965><s%> to open <S%H6605><s%> to my beloved; <S%H1730><s%> And my hands <S%H3027><s%> dripped <S%H5197><s%> with myrrh, <S%H4753><s%> And my fingers <S%H676><s%> with liquid <S%H5674><s%> myrrh, <S%H4753><s%> On the handles <S%H3709><s%> of the bolt. <S%H4514><s%>

"I opened <S%H6605><s%> to my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> But my beloved <S%H1730><s%> had turned <S%H2559><s%> away <S%H2559><s%> [and] had gone! <S%H5674><s%> My heart <S%H5315><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out [to him] as he spoke. <S%H1696><s%> I searched <S%H1245><s%> for him, but I did not find <S%H4672><s%> him; I called <S%H7121><s%> him, but he did not answer <S%H6030><s%> me.

"The watchmen who make <S%H5437><s%> the rounds <S%H5437><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> me, They struck <S%H5221><s%> me [and] wounded <S%H6481><s%> me; The guardsmen <S%H8104><s%> of the walls <S%H2346><s%> took <S%H5375><s%> away my shawl <S%H7289><s%> from me.

"I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you, O daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> If <S%H518><s%> you find <S%H4672><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> As to what <S%H4100><s%> you will tell <S%H5046><s%> him: For I am lovesick. <S%H2470><s%> <S%H160><s%>"

"What <S%H4100><s%> kind of beloved <S%H1730><s%> is your beloved, <S%H1730><s%> O most beautiful <S%H3303><s%> among women <S%H802><s%>? What <S%H4100><s%> kind of beloved <S%H1730><s%> is your beloved, <S%H1730><s%> That thus <S%H3602><s%> you adjure <S%H7650><s%> us?"
"My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is dazzling <S%H6703><s%> and ruddy, <S%H122><s%> Outstanding <S%H9082><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> ten <S%H7233><s%> thousand. <S%H7233><s%>

"His head <S%H7218><s%> is [like] gold, <S%H3800><s%> pure <S%H6337><s%> gold; <S%H6337><s%> His locks <S%H6977><s%> are [like] clusters <S%H8534><s%> of dates, <S%H8534><s%> [And] black <S%H7838><s%> as a raven. <S%H6158><s%>

"His eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like doves, <S%H3123><s%> Beside <S%H5921><s%> streams <S%H650><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> Bathed <S%H7364><s%> in milk, <S%H2461><s%> [And] reposed <S%H3427><s%> in [their] setting. <S%H4402><s%>

"His cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are like a bed <S%H6170><s%> of balsam, <S%H1314><s%> Banks <S%H4026><s%> of sweet-scented herbs; <S%H4840><s%> His lips <S%H8193><s%> are lilies, <S%H7799><s%> Dripping <S%H5197><s%> with liquid <S%H5674><s%> myrrh. <S%H4753><s%>

"His hands <S%H3027><s%> are rods <S%H1551><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> Set <S%H4390><s%> with beryl; <S%H8658><s%> His abdomen <S%H4578><s%> is carved <S%H6247><s%> ivory <S%H8127><s%> Inlaid <S%H5968><s%> with sapphires. <S%H5601><s%>

"His legs <S%H7785><s%> are pillars <S%H5982><s%> of alabaster <S%H9635><s%> Set <S%H3245><s%> on pedestals <S%H134><s%> of pure <S%H6337><s%> gold; <S%H6337><s%> His appearance <S%H4758><s%> is like Lebanon, <S%H3844><s%> Choice <S%H977><s%> as the cedars. <S%H730><s%>

"His mouth <S%H2441><s%> is [full of] sweetness. <S%H4477><s%> And he is wholly <S%H3605><s%> desirable. <S%H4261><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is my beloved <S%H1730><s%> and this <S%H2088><s%> is my friend, <S%H7453><s%> O daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>"
